citation.article-title: Relationship of Bacillus subtilis clades associated with strains 168 and W23: a proposal for Bacillus subtilis subsp. subtilis subsp. nov. and Bacillus subtilis subsp. spizizenii subsp. nov.

p.s: Description of Bacillus subtilis subsp. spizizenii subsp. nov.

Bacillus subtilis subsp. spizizenii (spi.zi.ze'ni.i. L. gen. n. spizizenii named after the American bacteriologist J. Spizizen, whose seminal studies of B. subtilis made this species a model organism of bacterial genetics)
The morphological, physiological and biochemical characteristics are the same as those of Bacillus subtilis subsp. subtilis.
DNA relatedness to B. subtilis subsp. subtilis ranges from 58 to 68 %.
Strains are moderately sexually isolated from strain 168.
Phylogeny based on inferred sequences of gyrA, polC and rpoB separates this subspecies from B. subtilis subsp. subtilis.
Ribitol is a principal cell wall constituent.
The type strain, NRRL B-23049T, was isolated from a Tunisian desert; it is deposited in the ARS Culture Collection.
